reviews.text: was grand! staff were friendly and hotel was grand!! there was no mice!!
reviews.title: twas grand!!!!
If ever the phrase "you get what you pay for" rang any truer...
reviews.text: Two great things about this hotel: The Location, The Price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have nothing else good to say about it! I figured that I would 'go budget' as I had the evening planned and new that all I needed was a clean bed to lie in for a few hours. This was the cheapest deal on a reputable website. Wish I had read the reviews first. It wasn't worth the pittance I paid for it!
reviews.title: Still dealing with them

likes.disliked: — lack of service, dirty rooms, still waiting on my reimbursement and online pics do not give justice

reviews.text: Tiny room (about as tall as me) room maybe one foot longer than the bed, horrible plain wallpaper, plastic garden furniture chair, tiny bathroom, blocked sink, bad smell, make your own bed.....
reviews.title: Not Bad at All.

reviews.text: Horrible lay out to the hotel too - it felt like a fire trap.
reviews.title: Manofa - good in parts

likes.disliked: — Quality of fixtures/ decor, cleanliness of corridors

reviews.title: it has to be said this place is a dive
reviews.text: this place is an absolute dump. decievingly clean lobby, staircases that lead to, well nowhere! didnt try the food cant complain about the location i would stay again if nowhere else was availabl any old port in a storm as they say

a 4 bed economy room,thats it apart from the 7ft by 3ft wardrobe, and 1 chair, no tv, kettle, glasses, and one strange thing you cant close the curtain as it was 3ft shorter than the window, but this did not matter as we were on the first floor and we overlooked a 5 foot wide alley way. knew when i booked that the toilet and bathroom were on the same landing, but what they did not mention, was that you have to go up 13 stairs to get to THE same landing ? Good points, the location, the staff, a good shower, and best for me and me mates is smoker friendly. bad points, not too clean, cold hotel, small and very basic, to get to front desk first you must climb everest (about 42 steep steps) . I would only recommend this hotel to stag/hen nighters. me and the friends i was with agree that its our first and only stay here
reviews.title: what a view, nextdoors windows

likes.disliked: — my mate took his daughters quilt! a pink playboy one

reviews.text: I stayed at the Manofa on the first weekend in april with 3 friends on a lads weekend away. We didn't expect much as we booked a four person economy room, but, boy did we get a shock it was so basic even the curtain didn't fit the window properly (three foot short). On one night we thought about just trashing the room, but, we reallised we'd only have caused 2 thousand pounds worth of improvements
reviews.title: Disappointed,won't be staying here again
Great on a budget if you like wildlife and adventure!
reviews.text: The hotel staff were friendly and the included continental breakfast was passable but very basic and served in the italian restaurant downstairs.
The location, on Damrak, is brilliant for those who want to be central to the energy that is Amsterdam, but, expect the worst.
reviews.title: Not that bad at all!

reviews.text: OK, so I'm just back from spending 4 days /3 nights in the worst hotel I've ever stayed in!! I have to agree with others on this site.
reviews.title: An absolute DUMP!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms don't resemble the pictures at all, the rooms where grubby, dingy and depressing and it's the only time I've been worried about the cleanliness of the bed linen!
reviews.title: Central but depressing...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can totally see why they want you to pay upfront - they want your money before you see the dump that this place is!!!
reviews.title: Location, breakfast, location, but only that!!!

likes.disliked: — The mouse, the beds, the lack of comfort

reviews.text: I agree again that the breakfast from the restaurant next door was pitiful, stale bread and cereal!! I've taken photos to prove the mess!!
reviews.title: get what u pay for

reviews.text: we asked to change rooms which helped a bit. But then the water stopped working and we had none!! - hot or cold - couldn't even flush the loo!!
reviews.title: Not as bad as I feared

reviews.text: Myself and my sisters and niece have just returned from 3 days at this hotel and i would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone no matter how desperate you are. When we got there and checked in and climbed 4 flights of stairs the room was alright (old fashioned and a bit smelly)and was prepared to stay there until a mouse ran over my foot. We went to reception and the girl was nice enough and moved us to another room.
reviews.title: Hell

reviews.text: I know this is a budget hotel (all we could get) but i would definitely spend more money next time for a better hotel. Had previously stayed in the Ramada last year in one of their star rooms this hotel was fab would recommend it.
reviews.title: Very much a budget hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here on the 24th Aug 2007 for 3 nights, having read the previous reviews I can honestly say that they are pretty correct on what they say. The hotel recepionist were pleasant, the bed linen and towels were clean, the towels were changed every day.
reviews.title: Wot no Mice?

likes.disliked: — lack of housekeeping outside of rooms

reviews.text: The stairs were very steep and winding and on the the 3rd floor where we were staying the sairs there had no carpet, on the landing there was a hole in he floor in one of the corners. During our stay we had a visit from mice, although we didn`t see them a packet of unopened biscuits had been opened with teeth marks in them, the room itself was pretty shabby stains on the wall grafitti in the wardrobe although shower was ok with hot water . Oh forgot to mention avoid the breakfast, you have been warned
reviews.title: not as bad as imagined.
The Worst
reviews.text: I was on a stag weekend with a group of 10 other lads so luckily i didn`t spend much time in the room, so although the hotel was terrible the location was pretty good, 200yards from central station and 2minute walk to the bars etc in the red light area. So if you have a very low budget and don`t mind steep stairs, extra guests (mice) and shabby rooms then go right ahead but for me I would look elsewhere
